name: desulfurisation of hard coal flue gas | SOx retained, in hard coal flue gas desulfurisation | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4083/documentation

This dataset represents the flue gas desulfurisation process of a hard coal power plant per 1 kg SOx retained. All environmental burdens associated with the operation of the scrubber are allocated to the SOx retained and hence to the operation of the power plant. The efficiency of the desulfurisation is 90%.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Desulfurisation process starting with the operation of a hard coal power plant.

This activity ends with 1 kg retained SOx resulting from the flue gas desulfurisation process of a coal power plant. The dataset includes apart the materials also the waste water emissions and the solid waste. The dataset doesn’t include the produced gypsum as a byproduct.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for an average European desulfurisation plant.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: About 85% of the installed capacity of desulphurization plants are installed as scrubber with lime or limestone (Vernon et al. 1990). The current proportion of desulfurisation with limestone is estimated with 80%. The additional consumption of electricity and heat for the desulfurisation process is taken into account in the net efficiency. ;The process steps are the detergent treatment, the absorption of flue gas components in the scrubbing suspension, the oxidation to sulfate (HSO3- to SO4-), the neutralization of the water suspension by the addition of limestone, crystallization of the gypsum, separation of the gypsum crystal from the mother liquor, calcination, pelleting or briquetting of gypsum for further use (IPP 1990, Baum 1988).;With limestone (CaCO3), the gases SO2, SO3, HCl and HF are absorbed in a scrubbing solution. Limestone has a low reactivity, but is preferred compared with quicklime (CaO) and slaked lime (Ca(OH)2 for economic reasons (IIP 1990). The de-dusted flue gas is either cooled in a pre-scrubber or directly cooled in the absorber. There, the hydrogen halides, the residual dust particulates and up to 20% of the SO2 are washed out. The suspension from the pre-scrubber can also be removed separately. Thus, mixing with the gypsum can be prevented. Droplet separators retain entrained liquid droplets and the clean gas is reheated and discharged through the chimney. By air intake oxidation is encouraged in the scrubber sump to form the gypsum. ;The pH-value, the ratio of the absorption liquid to the amount of exhaust gas and the concentration of absorption liquid significantly affect the separation efficiency. In (Hövelmann 1987) an efficiency of 95% is quantified. In other sources, this value is estimated at 80%. In the EU a value of 90% is obligatory, which can be achieved with a scrubber with limestone.;References:;Vernon J.L., Soud H.N. (1990) FGD installations on coal-fired plants. IEA Coal Research, London.;IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990) Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe.;Baum F. (1988) Luftreinhaltung in der Praxis. München, Deutschland.;Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.

flow.name: SOx retained, in hard coal flue gas desulfurisation
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Literature value. In the wastewater of the desulfurisation plant radioactive elements occur and must be detected. The radiation activities of these elements are not very relevant and the maximum values can be significantly (factor 10) higher.

Estimation. According to (Hövelmann 1987) 1.6 tons of limestone (CaCO3) per ton of SO2 is needed for a hard coal power plant (750 MW). The reaction equation of the limestone process is CaCO3 + 2H2O + SO2 + _O2 -> CaSO4 • 2H2O + CO2. It can be derived that stoichiometrically 1.56 kg of limestone is necessary and 0.69 kg of CO2 is produced per kg of SO2.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
Uerpmann E.-P. (1990) Betriebserfahrungen mit nasser Rauchgasentschwefelung in Braunkohlekraftwerken. In: VGB-Seminar Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken. Cottbus, Deutschland.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards.

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.

exchanges.description:
Literature value. The gypsum (CaSO2 * 2H2O) contains the retained sulfur and a certain amount of the input water. Gypsum resulting from wet lime scrubbing shows impurities of up to 6% (Calcite, CaCl2, Fluoride, flue ash, clays, silicates, quartz, ferric oxide, dolomite, siderite) (IIP 1990). Still, the quality of the gypsum is high enough so that it can be sold on the market. 

Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke). The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset. 

Source: 
IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990). Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe]

Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards.

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.

Literature value. 5 kg waste water per kg SO2 retained, containing all emissions to water in this dataset. An average sewage is assumed, which is a simplification. Initial input of water was 20kg; the remaining parts are in the gypsum, the sludge and in the air. 
This water can be used for humidification of the ash and is then disposed off together with the ash (Gebhard et al. 1989).

Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke). The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset. 

Gebhard G., Lukas W., Bambauer H.U. (1989) Stabilisierung von Rückständen aus der Braunkohleentschwefelung. In: VGB Kraftwerkstechnik 69, Heft 4, 1989, s.384-392.

Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards.

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.

Estimation. According to (Hövelmann 1987) 1.6 tons of limestone (CaCO3) per ton of SO2 is needed for a hard coal power plant (750 MW). The reaction equation of the limestone process is CaCO3 + 2H2O + SO2 + _O2 -> CaSO4 • 2H2O + CO2. It can be derived that stoichiometrically 1.56 kg of limestone is necessary and 0.69 kg of CO2 is produced per kg of SO2.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
Uerpmann E.-P. (1990) Betriebserfahrungen mit nasser Rauchgasentschwefelung in Braunkohlekraftwerken. In: VGB-Seminar Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken. Cottbus, Deutschland.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards.

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.

Literature value. The gypsum (CaSO2 * 2H2O) contains the retained sulfur and a certain amount of the input water. Gypsum resulting from wet lime scrubbing shows impurities of up to 6% (Calcite, CaCl2, Fluoride, flue ash, clays, silicates, quartz, ferric oxide, dolomite, siderite) (IIP 1990). Still, the quality of the gypsum is high enough so that it can be sold on the market. 

Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke). The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset. 

Source: 
IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990). Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe]

Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards.

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.

Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly used from Germany. These values are assumed for all of Europe, since the other operators in AUT and NL must meet similar environmental standards (Hövelmann 1987, Syring 1990, Grünewald et al. 1991, Kyte 1991, Bambauer et al. 1988).

Literature value. In the wastewater of the desulfurisation plant radioactive elements occur and must be detected. The radiation activities of these elements are not very relevant and the maximum values can be significantly (factor 10) higher.
